Class TexasHoldEm

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • TexasHoldEm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class TexasHoldEm
extends java.awt.Container
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    (c) 2012 Bohde Productions Inc. All Rights Reserved. This class creates the main interface used to play the game. It contains the menus and code structure to manage the players money throughout the casino and dealing with switching games, creating games, and quitting games.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • blindSpot

        private static int blindSpot
        Location of small blind

      • SMALL_BLIND

        private final int SMALL_BLIND
        Value of small blind
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BACKGROUND

        private final javax.swing.JLabel BACKGROUND
        Background image

      • takeTurn

        private final javax.swing.JButton takeTurn

      • monies

        private int[] monies
        An array holding the amount of money each player has. The user's money is monies[0]. The computer's monies (monies[1], monies[2], monies[3]) are all initialized each hand to Integer.MAX_VALUE to prevent them running out of money during a hand.

      • hand

        private Card[][] hand
        2D Array of cards to hold each players hand

      • river

        private java.util.ArrayList<Card> river
        The river. Cards will be added to this in deal().

      • bets

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> bets
        The bets of each player, flushed to the pot after the round.

      • betPrint

        private javax.swing.JLabel betPrint
        Label displaying how much money you have

      • onTable

        private javax.swing.JLabel onTable
        Label displaying how much money you have on the table (wagered)

      • pot

        private int pot
        The pot: the total wagered money to be won at the end of the hand

      • betIndex

        private int betIndex
        The location of the player who is currently betting

      • haveBet

        private int haveBet
        The number of players who have bet; used to ensure that every round of betting provides each player a chance to bet a minimum of once

      • deck

        private Deck deck
        The deck used in this game of Texas Hold Em

      • moveOn

        private javax.swing.JButton moveOn
        The button that will either make the user call, or allow them to check, depending on which is legal

        Used to prevent computers from continuing playing after user has folded

        public TexasHoldEm()

    • Method Detail

      • dealHands

        private void dealHands()
        Deals each player 2 cards, and flips the computer's cards face down.
        See Also:
        Card.flip()

      • takeBlinds

        private void takeBlinds()
        Takes the big and small blinds from the appropriate players money and adds it to the pot.

      • canMoveOn

        private boolean canMoveOn()
        Checks to see if gameplay can continue.
        Returns:
        true if everyone has bet at least once and all bets are the same (nobody must call). false otherwise.

      • dealFlop

        private void dealFlop()
        Deals the flop (the first three cards)

      • dealStreet

        private void dealStreet()
        Deals the 4th street (the 4th card)

      • dealRiver

        private void dealRiver()
        Deals the river (the 5th card)

      • computerBet

        private void computerBet()

      • deal

        private void deal()
        Deals the appropriate amount of cards based on gameplay
        See Also:
        dealFlop(), dealStreet(), dealRiver()

      • end

        private void end()
        Deals with finding winner(s) and quitting/restarting the game

      • getHand

        private java.lang.String getHand(int hand)
        Accessor for the hand that a player has
        Parameters:
        hand - the value of a hand to be translated
        Returns:
        a string representation for the hand.
        • <20 "Nothing"
        • <40 "Pair"
        • <60 "Two Pair"
        • <80 "Three of a Kind"
        • <10 "Straight"
        • <120 "Flush"
        • <140 "Full House"
        • <160 "Four of a Kind"
        • >=160 "Straight Flush"

      • moveOn

        private void moveOn(int index)
        Allows a player to check, if they can, or call
        Parameters:
        index - the player who is checking/calling (0-north/user, 1-east, 2-south, 3-west)

      • raise

        private void raise(int index)
        Raises the bet of a hand
        Parameters:
        index - the player who's raising (0-north/user, 1-east, 2-south, 3-west)

      • fold

        private void fold(int index)
        Folds a hand
        Parameters:
        index - the player who folded (0-north/user, 1-east, 2-south, 3-west)

      • resetGame

        private void resetGame()
        Kicks the user out of the casino if either are bankrupt; if not, prompts the user to either play again or quit to the home screen.

      • resetBackground

        private void resetBackground()
        Resets original main screen. Used when user chooses to leave table between hands.

      • canCheck

        private boolean canCheck(int index)
        Checks to see if a specific player can check or must call, raise, or fold.
        Parameters:
        index - the player to check if they can check or must call
        Returns:
        true if player at index index can check (their current bet is equal to previous index's bet), false if they must call (their current bet is greater than previous index's bet)

      • showMsgDlg

        private void showMsgDlg(java.lang.String message,
              java.lang.String titleMessage,
              int type)
        Convenience method for displaying a JOptionPane message dialog.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be displayed in the dialog box
        titleMessage - the message to be displayed in the dialog's title bar
        type - the type of message being displayed; affects the icon which is shown in the dialog. It is preferable to use a field of JOptionPane.
        See Also:
        JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE
